Class MainActivity

  • java.lang.Object

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.support.v4.app.ActivityCompat.OnRequestPermissionsResultCallback, android.support.v4.app.ActivityCompatApi23.RequestPermissionsRequestCodeValidator, android.support.v4.app.TaskStackBuilder.SupportParentable, android.support.v7.app.ActionBarDrawerToggle.DelegateProvider, android.support.v7.app.AppCompatCallback, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback

    public class MainActivity
extends android.support.v7.app.AppCompatActivity

    Central activity for a user. After logging in, this is the activity the user will be taken to whenever they open the app henceforth.


    See code attribution in Wiki: MainActivity


    Based on: Requesting Permissions at Run Time

    Author: Android Dev Docs

    Retrieved on: November 9th, 2016


    Based on: Android SwipeRefreshLayout how to implement canChildScrollUp if child is not a ListView or ScrollView

    Author: Twibit, iamlukeyb

    Posted on: October 10th, 2014

    Retrieved on: November 16th, 2016

    • Field Detail

      • mSectionsPagerAdapter

        private static MainActivity.SectionsPagerAdapter mSectionsPagerAdapter
        The PagerAdapter that will provide fragments for each of the sections. We use a FragmentPagerAdapter derivative, which will keep every loaded fragment in memory. If this becomes too memory intensive, it may be best to switch to a FragmentStatePagerAdapter.

      • activity

        private final android.app.Activity activity

      • mViewPager

        private android.support.v4.view.ViewPager mViewPager
        The ViewPager that will host the section contents.

      • changeFab

        private void changeFab(int position)
        Shows the correct FAB depending on what tab position we are at.
        Parameters:
        position - the current screen tab we are in (i.e. 0=Rider, 1=Driver)

      • onRequestPermissionsResult

        public void onRequestPermissionsResult(int requestCode,
                                       @NonNull
                                       java.lang.String[] permissions,
                                       @NonNull
                                       int[] grantResults)
        Result of the user granting or denying permissions. If they grant the permissions we don't need to do anything. If they do not grant the permissions, we should tell them that they are required for the map to be displayed and the app to function.
        Specified by:
        onRequestPermissionsResult in interface android.support.v4.app.ActivityCompat.OnRequestPermissionsResultCallback
        Overrides:
        onRequestPermissionsResult in class android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity
        Parameters:
        requestCode - This is the variable we use to request permission
        permissions - The permission string for external storage
        grantResults - The result of the request

      • checkPermissions

        private void checkPermissions()
        Asks user to grant required permissions for the maps to work.

      • logout

        private void logout()
        When back is pressed or the "Log Out" menu option is selected: Pop up a AlertDialog to confirm If they do indeed what to log out: open a new LoginActivity, while closing the current MainActivity otherwise remain in MainActivity.

      • makeRequest

        public void makeRequest(android.view.View view)
        When the user clicks on the add button this will start the make request activity so they can add a new request to our system
        Parameters:
        view - The calling view (Rider Floating Action Button)

      • startSearchActivity

        public void startSearchActivity(android.view.View view)
        This will start the Search activity for a driver when they want to search requests after they press the driver FAB. If they have internet, they will be navigated to the regular search screen to make their search. If they do not have internet, they will be immediately directed to a cache of their previous search results.
        Parameters:
        view - The calling view (Driver Floating Action Button)
